abstract: WikiLeaks lawyers say they are considering legal action against United States government and Google after learning that Justice Department, in March 2012, had seized company's data associated with accounts of three journalists who work for whistle-blowing organization.
lead_paragraph: Lawyers acting for WikiLeaks said Monday that they were exploring possible legal action against the American government and Google over the seizure of emails.
snippet: Lawyers acting for WikiLeaks said Monday that they were exploring possible legal action against the American government and Google over the seizure of emails.

headline.main: WikiLeaks Assails Google and the U.S.
headline.print_headline: WikiLeaks Assails Google and the U.S.
